Instructions:
1. Add lemons and ginger to the bottom of your favorite cup.
  2. Pour hot water into the cup.
  3. Stir in honey as desired. Enjoy!

1. Before getting started, lightly wet your work surface (as this will keep your rice paper wrapper from sticking).
  2. Take a single dry rice spring roll wrapper and place it in the bowl of lukewarm warm water. Let the the rice paper sit in the water for 10-20 seconds, or until it becomes pliable.
  3. This is the hard part: continue to feel how flexible the rice paper is. You want it to be soft and workable without being mushy. 
  4. When you feel like the rice paper is ready , take the spring roll wrapper out of the water and lay it down flat on your wet surface. You will want to work quickly from here.
  5. Starting in the center of the wrapper, place the carrot, zucchini and bell pepper slices in a rectangular shape, staying away from the edges of the wrapper.
  6. Continue to add all of the fillings, from the purple cabbage to the cilantro, by placing everything in the center, one by one, maintaining the rectangle shape in the middle. 
  7. Work quickly, you don’t want your wrapper to fall apart. When you’ve placed all of your ingredients in a nice little pile in the middle of the spring roll wrapper, it’s time to roll it shut!
  8. Note: Be careful not to overfill your spring roll wrapper because it will cause the rice paper to tear.
  9. Start by folding the top and bottom sections of the rice paper in over the vegetables.
  10. Starting on the left-hand side, stretch the left side of the wrapper around the pile of ingredients, tucking and rolling until you can rest the wrapper just under the ingredients.
  11. Tuck the corners in and then continue to roll the spring roll all the way, making your roll as tight as possible without ripping the rice paper wrapper.
  12. That's it, you just rolled your very own spring roll! Now, roll as many spring rolls as you would like and enjoy immediatley.
  13. Enjoy with your favorite dipping sauce. I recommend a Thai Peanut Sauce, anything with Ginger, Soy Sauce or Coconut Aminos!

1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
  2. For the shredded chicken (*make ahead):
  3. Add the chicken, chicken broth, onions, peppers, taco seasoning, garlic, salt and pepper to a slow cooker.
  4. Cook on high for 3 hours and then shred the chicken with two large forks. *Let the chicken cool completely before assembling your empanadas. I made my chicken the day before and placed it in the refrigerator overnight. To assemble the empanadas:
  5. In a small bowl whisk together 2 eggs for your egg wash. Set aside.
  6. Assemble your mise en place so you can work efficiently, like an assembly line. Unwrap the empanada shells, set out the hummus, chicken, corn and green chilies.
  7. Line 4 baking sheets with tin foil and top with a piece of parchment paper. [mv_img id="6540"]
  8. Lay your empanada shell in the empanada maker. (If you don't have an empanada maker, that's okay! Just lay it on a flat surface.)
  9. Using a small brush, or your fingers, brush the egg wash along the side of the empanada shell, where you will press each side together to close the empanada.
  10. Add a spoonful of hummus, a small bit of chicken, diced green chilies and corn to the middle of the empanada shell. *It may take you a few tries to get the proportions down right. You don't want it to be too stuffed because then everything will squish out, but you don't want it to be empty either! [mv_img id="6541"]
  11. Using the empanada maker or your hands fold the empanada in half and tightly seal the edges. [mv_img id="6542"]
  12. Place the sealed empanada on the parchment paper lined baking sheet. [mv_img id="6543"]
  13. Repeat the above steps until you have all of your empanadas made. [mv_img id="6544"]
  14. Place the empanadas in the oven for 20-25 minutes. You want to make sure the empanada shell is crisp to the touch.
  16. For the Supremely Spicy Hummus Dip:
  17. While the empanadas are cooking whisk together the hummus, Greek yogurt, and salt.
  18. When the empanadas are done cooking, remove from the oven, serve with the Supremely Spicy Hummus Dip, and enjoy! [mv_img id="6545"]

1. Put all of the ingredients in a high-speed blender and blend on high for 60-seconds, or until smooth.
  2. Pour into 2 cups & enjoy.

1. Slice your banana into 1/4 inch slices.
  2. Top each banana with peanut butter.
  3. *Tip: Want to make life easier? Put your peanut butter into a sandwich bag and smooth it down into a bottom corner. Then take a pair of scissors and snip off the tip of the corner. Voila! You can easily squeeze out the peanut butter onto the banana slices with no mess!
  4. Top the peanut butter with the Nutella. Use the same technique above for a prettier presentation.
  5. Sprinkle your chia seeds, flax seeds, and raw cacao nibs over the banana peanut butter stacks.
  6. Optional - freeze your banana peanut butter stacks! They make an excellent frozen treat!

1. In a large bowl add the oats, almonds, chia seeds, collagen peptides, and 1 tablespoon of coconut flakes. Stir together to mix well.
  2. Add the dates, coconut milk, hemp butter, maple syrup, almond extract, and CBD oil.
  3. Using a spatula, or clean hands, mix everything together well until all ingredients are well incorporated
  4. Create 1" balls and roll them between your palms until they are perfectly ball-shaped. If you are doing a chocolate drizzle, set these balls aside on parchment paper.
  5. When all the bites are formed, roll each ball in the remaining coconut flakes and return to the parchment paper.
  6. In a small microwave-safe dish, microwave the chocolate chips for 60 seconds. Remove, stir, and add coconut oil, microwave for another 30 seconds.
  7. Remove and stir. Microwave in additional 30-second intervals as needed until smooth.
  8. Gently pour the chocolate into the corner of a ziplock bag. Snip a small piece off the corner and drizzle away.

1. Cook the soba noodles according to package directions. Drain, and set aside to cool.
  2. In a large bowl, whisk together the water, sugar, fish sauce, lime juice, red chili paste, and minced garlic until the sugar is dissolved.
  3. Add the bell pepper, carrots, red onion, zucchini, the white part of the scallion and shrimp to the bowl. Toss all ingredients well to coat.
  4. Divide the vegetable mixture evenly among one-half of four separate, large, 2-compartment glass meal prep containers. Top with remaining green scallions and cashews.
  5. Fill the remaining compartment with the cooked soba noodles. Store in the refrigerator.

1. Mix all ingredients together in a bowl with a whisk until well incorporated.
  2. Store in a mason jar for future use.

1. Place the chickpeas in a food processor and pulse on high for 30 seconds.
  2. Add the peanut butter, maple syrup, powdered peanut butter, vanilla, and salt. Pulse until a smooth consistency is achieved.
  3. Transfer to a medium-sized bowl and gently fold in chocolate chips.
  4. Place in the refrigerator for 5-minutes before rolling into 1" balls.

For the Chocolate Drizzle:

  1. Place the chocolate chips and coconut oil in a microwave-safe container.
  2. Microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring in between until the chocolate is melted smooth.
  3. Drizzle over the 1" cookie dough bites. Enjoy!

1. Cut the avocado in half and remove the seed.
  2. Scoop each half into the food processor.
  3. Add the raspberries, syrup, cocoa powder, milk, and cinnamon to the food processor.
  4. Pulse on high for 60-90 seconds, scraping down the edges and blend again as needed.
  5. Garnish with more fresh berries and raw cacao nibs or chocolate chips as desired.

1. In a food processor or blender, add the bananas, berries, and mint. Pulse for 3, 15-second intervals.
  2. Add the coconut milk, coconut cream, and vanilla extract. Blend on high for 60-90 seconds, or until smooth.
  3. Portion out into a freezer-safe container or popsicle mold.
  4. Place in the freezer for at least 1 hour, ideally overnight.

1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
  2. In a food processor, add the walnuts, ground flax seeds, pitted dates, and salt. Pulse until the ingredients begin to come together to a fine consistency.
  3. While the food processor is still running, very slowly pour in the aquafaba. Pulse for another 60 seconds before removing the mixture from the processor.
  4. Divide the mixture in half and place each half on a separate sheet of parchment paper. Roll each half into balls.
  5. Lightly coat a nonstick rolling pin with a dab of coconut oil.
  6. With the rolling pin, quickly flatten out the ball. *You don't want to overwork this. Use the rolling pin to get the basic flat shape, but then you want to use your hands to get the crust flat. [mv_img id="6461"]
  7. This is a labor of love, so be patient. Working from the inside out, gently flatten the crust to approximately 1/4 inch thickness. You do not want the crust to be too thin, but you do want the crust to be a uniform thickness so it will cook evenly. Smooth any cracks with your fingers.
  8. When ready, gently drape the parchment paper over a small, upside down, oven-safe bowl to create your 'bowl'. Use your fingers to mend any cracks. [mv_img id="6462"]
  9. Place the bowl on a cookie sheet and cover the crust with a sheet of foil. Bake in the oven for 30 minutes.
  10. After 30 minutes remove the foil and bake for another 3 minutes. Watch carefully to be sure the crust does not get too dark.
  11. Remove from oven and let cool completely, while still molded over the bowl. [mv_img id="6464"]
  12. When the crust is completely cool, gently remove the parchment paper. [mv_img id="6465"]
  13. Set right side up. [mv_img id="6466"]
  14. Fill each salad bowl with spring mix, apples, beets, cranberries, and walnuts.
  15. Drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette and enjoy.

1. Linea baking sheet with a sheet of parchment paper and set aside.
  2. In a food processor, add the oatmeal, chia seeds, ground flax seeds, and slivered almonds. Mix together for 30 seconds, or until an even, yet slightly coarse texture is achieved. Transfer this to a large mixing bowl when done.
  3. Add the chopped dates and plant-based milk to the large mixing bowl and stir well.
  4. In a microwave-safe container warm the almond butter and coconut oil on high for 30 seconds.
  5. Add the maple syrup and optional extract to the butter and oil bowl and mix well.
  6. Add the almond butter mixture to the oatmeal mixture and mix together well.
  7. Use a 1" scoop to evenly portion the dough into balls.
  8. When finished scooping all 20 balls, place them in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.
  9. After the dough chills, remove the dough one by and roll between your palms until they are perfectly ball-shaped, set the finished ball on the parchment paper.
  10. Using your paper straw, carefully push the end through the center of each pop until they are approximately 3/4 of the way through. Then remove.
  11. Freeze for 10 minutes.

Chocolate Coating

  1. While the pops are in the freezer you will need to prepare the chocolate.
  2. Place the chocolate chips and coconut oil in a small microwaveable container, like a glass cup.
  3. Microwave on high for seconds. Remove, stir, and return to the microwave for another 30 seconds.
  4. Remove and stir, and if needed microwave for an additional 30 seconds.
  5. Dip the end of each cake pop stick into the chocolate and place it in the hole you already made. Return each pop to the freezer for another 5 minutes.
  6. Remove the pops from the freezer dip each one in the chocolate and gently twirl until the excess chocolate has dripped off.
  7. Place in your foam board stand. If you're going to garnish your pops with anything, now is the time to do so. I used raw unsweetened coconut flakes, sprinkles, and my edible pink glitter sugar.
  8. Enjoy!

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with foil, spray with cooking spray and set aside.
    2. Lightly drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil over the caps of the mushrooms, flip, and repeat on the gill side. Season with salt and pepper and place onto the baking sheet gill side up.
    3. Place in the oven to bake for 10 minutes.
    4. While the mushrooms are cooking, add the remaining olive oil to a cast-iron skillet over medium heat. When the oil is hot, add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute.
    5. Begin to add the kale by the handful, it will begin to wilt down as it cooks. Gradually add the vegetable stock as the kale wilts.
    6. After you've added all of the kale and it has cooked down, stir in the beans, and lemon juice.
    7. Let cook for another 2 minutes, stirring frequently until most of the liquid is evaporated.
    8. Remove the mushrooms after 10 minutes, remove them from the oven and fill the caps with the greens & beans mixture.
    9. Sprinkle each mushroom cap with mozzarella cheese. Place back into the oven for 3 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and is lightly golden brown.

Put all of the ingredients in a high-speed blender and blend on high for 60-seconds, or until smooth.
    Pour into 2 cups & enjoy.

1. Place a diffuser between the stove and a medium sized pot.
  2. Add coconut milk to the pot and gently bring to a boil.
  3. Once boiling, add quinoa and reduce heat to low. Cover loosely.
  4. Cook for 15 minutes or until the all of the coconut milk is absorbed.
  5. Turn off the heat and let stand for 5 minutes.
  6. While the quinoa is cooking, prepare the pineapple if you are using fresh.
  7. If you want to serve this tasty breakfast in a literal pineapple bowl, just follow these directions.
  8. Carefully cut the pineapple in half lengthwise.
  9. Using a paring knife, gently cut out the core.
  10. Scoop the remaining pineapple out of the skin, being careful not to puncture the skin.
  11. Take the pineapple that has been removed from the skin and gently mash and remove any large chunks. [mv_img id="6405"]
  12. After the quinoa has sat on the stove without heat for 5 minutes, stir in your fresh or crushed pineapple and shredded coconut.
  13. Stir well. [mv_img id="6406"]
  14. Top with toppings.
  15. If meal prepping, portion out quinoa into 5 containers. [mv_img id="6407"]
  16. Enjoy! [mv_img id="6408"]

1. In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine the berries, water, honey, lemon juice, and pumpkin pie spice. Stir well and bring to a boil.
    2. Once boiling, stir in the chia seeds, stirring well to ensure they do not clump.
    3. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
    4. Let cool before serving.

1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F
  2. Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds.
  3. Lay the spaghetti squash face up on a foil-lined baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste. Place in the oven for 40 minutes.
  4. While the spaghetti squash is cooking, prepare another foil-lined baking sheet.
  5. Using a mandoline, slice the eggplant, zucchini, or yellow squash into 1/4 inch thick slices.
  6. Dip in the beaten egg until well coated.
  7. Cover each eggplant slice evenly with homemade bread crumbs on both sides.
  8. Place each breaded eggplant cutlet on the foil lined baking sheet.
  9. Cook the eggplant for 10 minutes.
  10. Carefully remove from the oven, flip each cutlet, and return to the oven for another 10 minutes or until golden brown.
  11. When the spaghetti squash is fully cooked (easily pierced with a fork) remove from the oven and fill each half with half of your spaghetti sauce.
  12. Top with the eggplant cutlets.
  13. Add the rest of the sauce.
  14. Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese on top.
  15. Place back into the oven for 5 minutes to warm the sauce and melt the cheese.
  16. Remove and garnish with basil pesto and dried parsley or basil if desired.
  17. Enjoy!

For the Broccoli Bites

  1. Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line 2 baking sheets with foil, coat with cooking spray and set aside.
  2. In a large stockpot over medium-high heat, bring 3-4 quarts of cold water to a boil.
  3. When boiling, add the broccoli florets, stir well and return to a boil for 2 minutes.
  4. Add the kale, bring back to a boil, and cook for another 2 minutes.
  5. Turn off the heat, drain the hot water, and run the broccoli and kale under cold water to stop the cooking process. Set aside.
  6. To a food processor, add the onion, garlic, and parsley and pulse until minced.
  7. Add the cooked broccoli and kale and pulse in 15-second intervals until broken down into smaller chunks.
  8. Add the remainder of the ingredients to the food processor and pulse until everything is incorporated and in a uniform size.
  9. Scoop out ½ ounce scoops of the mixture and form into bite-sized balls and place them on the baking sheet. Repeat until all of the mixtures are made up.
  10. Press down slightly and lightly spray the tops with cooking spray.
  11. Bake in the oven for 10 minutes. Flip the bites with a spatula and return to the oven for another 10 minutes, or until fully cooked and golden brown.

For the Turmeric Yogurt Dip

  1. Mix the yogurt, turmeric, chipotle powder, salt, and pepper until well incorporated.
  2. Dip the warm baked broccoli bites into the turmeric yogurt dip and enjoy it.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees

  1. In a medium-sized bowl, mash the bananas. Set aside.
  2. In a small bowl, mix together the coconut milk beverage and apple cider vinegar. Set aside.
  3. In a large bowl, combine the dry ingredients: flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg. Make a well in the center. Set aside.
  4. In another medium bowl, with a beater, cream together the coconut oil and coconut sugar.
  5. Add the mashed bananas to the creamed oil and sugar, followed by the coconut milk & vinegar mixture and vanilla. Beat until well incorporated.
  6. Pour the wet ingredients into the well made with the dry ingredients and mix until well combined. Do not over mix.
  7. Grease two 9" loaf pans and pour the batter evenly into each pan.

Walnut Streusel Topping

  1. Mix the crushed walnuts, flour, coconut flakes, and sugar well.
  2. Pour in melted coconut oil and mix together.
  3. Top each loaf of bread with the streusel topping.

To Bake

  1. Evenly space the two loaf pans in the oven and bake for 45 minutes, or until you can insert a toothpick in the middle and it comes out clean.
  2. Let cool on a baking rack for 20 minutes.

1. Add the sliced kiwifruit to a 6-quart slow cooker.
  2. Add cinnamon sticks and whole cloves.
  3. Cover with water and set slow cooker to high for 2 hours.
  4. After two hours, use a potato masher or a whisk to break down the kiwi.
  5. Stir in the honey and turmeric.
  6. Return heat to low for an additional 2 hours.
  7. After 2 hours, turn the heat off and allow to cool for 1 hour.
  8. When cool enough to handle, arrange a large bowl underneath a fine mesh strainer lined with cheese cloth.
  9. Strain all of the liquid into a large bowl.
  10. Discard the solid contents.
  11. Garnish with a cinnamon sugar ring and enjoy! [mv_img id="4448"]

1. Place each Lipton® Pure Green teabag into a mason jar.
  2. Pour hot water over the tea bags and brew for 2-5 minutes, depending on how strong you want the flavor.
  3. Remove bags.
  4. In each mason jar, stir in 1/2 teaspoon of ginger, 1 teaspoon of honey and 1 teaspoon of chia seeds.
  5. Add ¾ cup of oatmeal into each mason jar.
  6. Add a top and shake well.
  7. Let sit in the refrigerator at least 6 hours (ideally overnight) before enjoying it.
  8. You can enjoy this delicious recipe either hot or cold, depending on your personal preference!
  9. Top with dried figs, and additional honey as desired. Enjoy!

For the Salad:

  1. In a large bowl, toss together the salad mix, sliced fennel, grapefruit, tangerine, pumpkin seeds and feta cheese.

For the Pomegranate Rosemary Vinaigrette:

  1. Add the pomegranate juice to a small saucepan and place on the stove, on a simmer burner if you have one. If you have a heat diffuser, add that between the pan and the stove as well.
  2. Remove the rosemary from the stem and add the sprigs to the saucepan.
  3. Turn the heat to medium-low and let this remain on the stove for 20 minutes to reduce. After 20 minutes you should have about half the original volume you started with.
  4. Strain to remove the rosemary leaves and measure to ensure you have 3/4 cup of reduced pomegranate juice remaining.
  5. Combine the reduced pomegranate juice with the rice wine vinegar, lemon juice, honey, chopped rosemary, garlic, and black pepper.
  6. Blend together, using an immersion blender if you have one, or in a traditional blender.
  7. Continue to let the blender run while slowly drizzling in a stream of olive oil.
  8. Drizzle the vinaigrette over the salad ingredients and toss well to combine.

1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit, use the convection setting if available.
  2. Line a baking sheet with foil, set aside.
  3. Slice the sweet potatoes into 1/4" slices - very carefully! Use a mandolin to help.
  4. Place the sweet potatoes on the foil lined baking sheet and spray with cooking spray. Flip over and spray the other side.
  5. Put into the oven for 15 minutes.
  6. After 15 minutes, flip each sweet potato over and return to the oven.
  7. While the sweet potatoes are cooking, mix together the cream cheese style spread, chili garlic paste and lemon juice.
  8. Once your sweet potato toasts are ready, top them with the Greek yogurt mixture. and garnish with lemon zest and fennel if desired.
  9. Enjoy! (P.S. You can enjoy the sweet potato toasts both warm from the oven or cool!)

1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
  2. Line a baking pan with foil and set aside.
  3. Drizzle each squash half with olive oil and salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Place in the oven for 40 minutes.

For the Lentils

  1. While the squash is roasting, prepare the lentils according to package directions. Different types of lentils require different cooking times. Cook lentils should yield about 4 prepared cups.
  2. When the lentils are done cooking, strain, or drain any leftover water as necessary.
  3. Add to the lentils: olive oil, minced garlic, cumin, turmeric, granulate onion, and coriander. Mix well.
  4. After the acorn squash has been roasting for 40 minutes, remove from the oven, and carefully add the lentil mixture to the hollowed squash. Return to the oven while preparing the eggs.
  5. For the egg topping, feel free to cook your eggs any way you choose. Fried eggs are perfect. If you want to make it easy, coat a muffin tin with cooking spray and crack 1 egg into each well. Place in the oven with the squash and cook for 15 minutes, or until firm.
  6. Remove the squash and the eggs from the oven. Top the squash with the eggs and optional garnish. Enjoy!

1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees, convection bake if available.
  2. Line two baking sheets with aluminum foil, set aside.
  3. Cut the potatoes hasselback style, according to the directions above.
  4. Place the cut hasselback potatoes on the foil lined baking sheets and brush with olive oil, sprinkled with Italian seasoning.
  5. If you're making the unloaded version of these potatoes, you can put them directly into the oven now for 45 minutes.
  6. If you're making the loaded version, take two of the bacon slices, still raw, and cut into 1/4 inch pieces.
  7. Gently stuff the small bacon pieces into the slats of the potatoes, with about 3 pieces of bacon per potato.
  8. Take the remaining two slices of bacon and add them to the foil lined baking sheet.
  9. Place into the oven for 45 minutes.
  10. After about 20 minutes, be sure to remove the two single slices of bacon, let cook and crumble.
  11. After 45 minutes, remove the potatoes from the oven. If you're making the unloaded version, serve immediately.
  12. If making the loaded version, gently sprinkle with cheese immediately.
  13. Add the Greek yogurt to a sandwich bag and pull all the yogurt to one corner. Cut a very small tip of the corner off so you can perfectly decorate you potatoes.
  14. Top with scallions, and additional salt & pepper for taste.
  15. Enjoy!

1. In a large bowl, mix together the yogurt and maple syrup.
  2. Separate into two individual bowls or meal prep containers.
  3. Top each bowl evenly with kiwi and mango. Garnish with goji berries, chia seeds, raw cacao nibs if using. Enjoy!

1. In a small food processor, blend together the avocado, yogurt, lime juice, and taco seasoning until smooth. Set aside.
  2. Set out tortillas and fill with a hearty dollop of hummus.
  3. Add your fresh toppings.
  4. Top with avocado cream. Garnish with sprouts. Enjoy!

1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees, use convection if possible.
  2. Line a baking sheet with foil and set aside.
  3. If your bread is not stale, lightly toast it in a toaster or toaster oven. When cool enough to handle, remove the toast and gently tear it into small pieces.
  4. Add the pieces to a food processor along with the rest of the ingredients.
  5. Slowly pulse until the bread begins to break down into a uniform, fine consistency.
  6. When your desired consistency is achieved, pour the breadcrumbs onto the baking sheet. Smooth to create a single layer.
  7. Place into the oven to bake for 5 minutes.
  8. Remove from the oven and gently toss the breadcrumbs with a wooden spoon, rearranging to a single layer again.
  9. Return to the oven to bake for another 5 minutes, or until lightly golden brown.
  10. Let cool and store in an airtight container for up to 1 month.

For The Eggs

  1. Boil and peel one dozen eggs using the method of your choice.
  2. Slice each egg in half and carefully remove the yolk. Set the yolks aside in a medium-sized bowl to by dyed.

For the All-Natural Dyes

PINK:

  1. Drain one can of sliced beets, collecting the juice. The beets can be saved for later, but here we want to reserve that beautiful pink juice for our dye. You can add water as desired to get the color you are looking for. More water will result in a lighter pink.

PURPLE:

  1. Take 1 cup of frozen blueberries and let thaw (can use the microwave if needed). Use a fork to mash the berries as they thaw to collect the juice. Save the blueberry pulp for baking or smoothies!

YELLOW:

  1. Mix 1 tablespoon of turmeric powder in 1 cup of warm water.

To Dye the Eggs

  1. Once you have your natural dyes ready to go, place the eggs whites in each color. How long you leave the egg in the natural dye will determine the richness of the color. The ones pictured in this recipe were in the liquid for approximately 30 minutes. Try a variety of times for different shades of pink, purple, and yellow.
  2. While the egg whites are sitting in the dye, you can begin to prepare your filling.

For the Deviled Egg Filling

  1. Combine the reserved egg yolks with the Greek yogurt, ground mustard, parsley flakes, vinegar, and salt. Mash well with a fork. Let sit for 10 minutes.
  2. Divide the egg yolk mixture in half, one to be made pink and one to be made yellow.
  3. In one half of the mixture, add in 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric. Mix well. If the mixture seems too dry, add another 1/2 tablespoon of Greek yogurt.
  4. In the other half of the mixture, add 1/2 teaspoon of beet juice and mix well.
  5. To fill the dyed eggs with the yolk mixture, all you need is two ziplock bags. If you want to get fancy you can use a piping tip. Simply snip a small corner off the ziplock bag, place the piping tip in if you're using one, and fill the bag with the yolk mixture.
  6. When the egg whites are the color you desire, remove and set them hollow side down on a piece of paper towel for a minute or two to dry. Flip over when dry.
  7. Gently squeeze your ziplock bag to fill each egg white. I filled my yellow and purple eggs with pink filling and my pink eggs with yellow filling.
  8. Sprinkle with paprika as desired. Enjoy!

1. Preheat the gas grill to high. You want it hot!
  2. Wash the asparagus and blackberries.
  3. Snap the woody ends off the asparagus as needed.
  4. Gently skewer the blackberries on a wooden skewer, 3-4 berries per skewer.
  5. Place the asparagus and blackberry skewers in a roasting pan and gently toss in vegetable oil. (Do not use olive oil! You will be cooking at a very high temperature which will exceed the smoke point of the EVOO and ruin the dish! Just trust me!)
  6. Using tongs, carefully place the spears of asparagus on the grill. Let the asparagus sear until tender, flipping once as needed.
  7. After flipping the asparagus half way through cooking, add the blackberry skewers to the grill, flipping once as needed.
  8. While the asparagus is cooking, add the almonds to a dry saute pan and place on the grill. Gently toss the almonds as needed until they turn slightly golden brown.
  9. When everything is ready, carefully plate the asparagus topped with a blackberry skewer. Add the toasted almonds and drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.

Fresh Fruit Spring Rolls

  1. The key to successfully rolling spring rolls is to be sure everything is prepped and ready to go before attempting to start!
  2. In a shallow bowl (a glass pie pan works great) mix equal parts of warm water and the juice from the drained can of beets. Approximately 1/2 cup each.
  3. Using your hands, wet your work surface, like a smooth cutting board, as this will keep your rice paper from getting stuck to the surface.
  4. Dip the wrapper in the bowl for 10-20 seconds until it remains firm yet pliable.
  5. Lay your wrapper on the wet surface and work quickly to add the ingredients.
  6. Start by laying down the sliced strawberries, watermelon, blueberries, citrus zest, and mint. Finish by adding the zoodles.
  7. Be careful not to over or under fill your spring roll wrapper. It may take you a trial run or two to get it just right. Work quickly because you don't want your wrapper to lose moisture or become mushy.
  8. Start on either the left or right-hand side and stretch one side of the wrapper around the pile of ingredients, tucking and rolling the paper until the pile is neatly pulled together.
  9. Then pull in the top and bottom flaps. Tuck in any corners and continue to roll all the way, making the spring roll as tight as possible.
  10. Repeat steps 1-9 and roll as many as desired.

For the Strawberry Mint Dip

  1. In a small food processor, blend together the yogurt, strawberries, mint and lemon juice on high for 60-90 seconds or until completely smooth.
  2. Pair with fresh fruit spring rolls & enjoy!

In the Instant Pot

  1. In the Instant Pot, combine the washed quinoa and coconut milk. Whisk together well.
  2. Set to high pressure and cook for 1 minute. Allow to stand for 10 minutes on natural pressure relief.
  3. Carefully remove the lid and stir in the vanilla, turmeric, cinnamon, ginger, black pepper, and salt.
  4. Top with pears, raisins, and coconut flakes as desired.

On the Stove Top

  1. Rinse the quinoa under cold water.
  2. Combine the quinoa and coconut milk in a medium sauce pan and place over medium heat.
  3. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to simmer and cover with a tight fitting lid. Cook 10-15 minutes until most of the liquid is absorbed.
  4. Remove from the heat and stir in the rest of the ingredients: vanilla, turmeric, cinnamon, ginger, black pepper, and salt.
  5. Top with pears, raisins, and coconut flakes as desired.

1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
  2. Place the sweet potatoes on a foil-lined baking sheet and place in the oven for 45 minutes, or until tender enough to pierce with a fork.
  3. After removing the sweet potato from the oven, allow the sweet potato to cool enough to handle.
  4. Gently peel back some of all of the skin.
  5. Sprinkle with cinnamon and cloves.
  6. Top with peanut butter. (Want to be fancy? Put the peanut butter into a plastic ziplock bag and microwave for 20 seconds. Snip the tip of a corner of the bag and drizzle away!)
  7. Garnish with coconut flakes, raw cacao, and walnuts. Enjoy!

1. In a medium-sized bowl, whisk together the cassava flour, garlic powder, salt and pepper.
  2. Add the olive oil followed by the water and mix with a spatula until a dough forms. Once the mixture is thick enough, remove it from the bowl and knead the dough until well combined.
  3. Divide the dough into 6 even-sized portions and roll into balls.
  4. Place a dough ball between two sheets of parchment paper and using a rolling pin, roll thin.
  5. Heat a dry skill over medium-high heat.
  6. Add the flattened dough to the dry skillet and cook 2-3 minutes or until bubbles begin to form.
  7. Flip the tortilla once lightly browned on one side and cook an additional 2-3 minutes on the other.
  8. Repeat steps 6-7 until 6 tortillas are made.

1. Prepare your Homemade Beet Tortilla Wraps per recipe directions.
  2. Spread the hummus over the wrap evenly.
  3. Top with spiralized beets.
  4. Top with your favorite veggies.
  5. Enjoy!
1. Mix all of your ingredients together and enjoy!

1. In an Instant Pot, combine the dry jasmine rice and 3 1/2 cups of the coconut milk beverage.
  2. Lock the lid in place, select high pressure for 3 minutes cook time.
  3. When the 3 minutes are up, turn off the Instant Pot and use a natural pressure release for 10 minutes.
  4. After 10 minutes, release any remaining pressure with a quick pressure release as needed.
  5. Once the rice is ready, stir in the coconut cream, maple syrup, ground cinnamon, turmeric, ginger, vanilla and coconut extract and golden raisins.
  6. Note* This recipe includes and extra 1 cup of coconut milk beverage. This is for you to use at your own discretion, depending on how thick or runny you like your rice pudding. Everyone likes it different, so make it however you will enjoy it the most.
  7. Garnish with more golden raisins as desired.

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Prepare a foil-lined baking sheet and set aside.
  2. In a gallon-sized ziplock bag, combine the chicken breast and 1/2 cup of the lemon vinaigrette. Let sit to marinate for at least 20 minutes.
  3. After the chicken has marinated, discard the excess marinade and evenly lay the chicken on the foil-lined baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Bake the chicken for 20 minutes, flipping once halfway through. Ensure the chicken has been cooked to an internal temperature of 165°F.
  5. Once cool enough to handle, chop or shred the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
  6. While the chicken is cooking, mix together the kale, red cabbage and shaved Brussels sprouts for the base of your salad. Spread evenly among four bowls or meal prep containers.
  7. Top each salad evenly with the bell pepper, plum, peach or nectarine, and blueberries.
  8. Top with chopped chicken.
  9. Serve with the remaining lemon vinaigrette and enjoy!

1. Prepare all your ingredients ahead of time so you have your mise en place ready.
  2. Toss the basil and spinach together.
  3. Divide the spinach and basil combo evenly among 2 large bowls or Tupperware containers.
  4. Add 1 cup of cooked quinoa to each bowl.
  5. Divide cherry tomatoes, avocado, mozzarella evenly among each bowl.
  6. Just before serving, drizzle half the olive oil and half the balsamic glaze onto each salad.
  7. Finish with a squirt of lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste.
  8. Enjoy!

1. Lightly toast your English muffins, set aside.
  2. In a large frying pan, add the butter and crack 4 eggs.
  3. Cook the eggs to your desired doneness, we recommend over-hard.
  4. While still in the pan, top each egg with 2 slices of uncured ham and one slice of cheese. Allow cooking until the cheese begins to melt.
  5. Place each egg stack in between the lightly toasted muffins.
  6. Wrap each sandwich tightly in parchment paper followed by saran wrap. They will be freezer-friendly for up to 3 months.
  7. When you're ready to thaw, simply place in the refrigerator overnight. Remove the saran wrap and microwave for 90 seconds, or until warm.

1. Add the toasted walnuts, garlic cloves, and fresh Parmesan cheese to the food processor and begin to pulse in 5-second intervals until the walnuts, garlic, and cheese become a fine consistency.
  2. Add the basil through crushed red pepper to the food processor.
  3. Turn the food processor to medium-low speed and very slowly pour in the olive oil.
  4. Continue to blend for an additional 60 seconds or until all of the ingredients are broken down and well incorporated.
  5. Store the fresh pesto in a mason jar in the refrigerator or freeze according to the directions above this recipe.

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F. Grease a 9” glass baking dish with cooking spray. Set aside.
    2. To a high-speed blender add all ingredients banana through the nutmeg and blend on high in 30-second intervals until smooth.
    3. Add the rolled oats to a large mixing bowl. Pour the blender mixture over the oats and stir until the oatmeal is well coated.
    4. Transfer the mixture to the glass baking dish. Top with crushed walnuts and sliced apples.
    5. Bake for 45 minutes or until firm and golden brown.

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with foil and brush with 1 teaspoon of extra-virgin olive oil. Set aside.
  2. Drain the excess water from the container of tofu and dice into 1-inch pieces.
  3. Press the tofu between two clean towels for 15 minutes to wick away additional moisture. (New to pressing tofu? See this recipe for additional instructions.)
  4. In a large bowl, whisk together the vinegar, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper.
  5. Add the tofu and Brussels sprouts to the bowl and toss gently until all ingredients are well coated.
  6. Transfer the ingredients to the lined baking sheet and arrange in a single layer. Bake for 20 minutes.
  7. Remove the sheet pan from the oven and stir.
  8. Evenly spread the cranberries and pumpkin seeds across the entire sheet pan. Return to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
  9. Remove from the oven and drizzle with balsamic glaze just before serving.

1. Preheat the oven to 350 ℉. Line a large baking sheet with foil and set aside.
  2. In a large mixing bowl, toss together the delicata squash, chickpeas, olive oil, salt, pepper, cinnamon, paprika, and whole thyme sprigs until mixed well.
  3. Spread the mixture out in an even layer on the baking sheet. Place in the oven to bake for 30 minutes.
  4. After 30 minutes, remove the sheet pan from the oven and add the dried cranberries and pumpkin seeds to the baking sheet.
  5. Return the baking sheet to the oven and bake for an additional 5 minutes. Remove after 5 minutes.
  6. Arrange the chopped kale in a large bowl. Top with cooked quinoa and the warm ingredients from the baking pan.
  7. Drizzle with maple syrup and enjoy!

1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees and bake the sweet potatoes for 35-40 minutes, or until soft inside. Set aside and let cool. *Make chia seed pudding below while waiting for potatoes to cool.
  2. *Beginners Note: When making the chia seed pudding, choose a container with a tight-fitting lid, as you will want to shake it vigorously before refrigerating. I use a mason jar!
  3. Add the coconut milk, chia seeds, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and cloves to your container and attach the lid.
  4. Shake the container vigorously for 60 seconds. This will ensure all of the chia seeds are coated with liquid and there will be no clumps in your pudding.
  5. Refrigerate at least 1 hour, and shake at least once in between.
  6. Once the potatoes are cool, scoop the flesh of the sweet potato into a food processor and discard the skins.
  7. Add the grated ginger and water to the food processor. Blend for several minutes until the mixture is completely smooth. Add more water if needed.
  8. Layer the chia seed pudding with the sweet potato mixture into four containers.
  9. Top with shredded coconut. Enjoy!

1. Heat olive oil in a large cast-iron pan or nonstick skillet over medium heat.
  2. Add the onions and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently.
  3. Add the bell pepper strips and cook an additional 5 minutes, stirring frequently until peppers and onions are softened.
  4. Stir in the minced garlic. Add kale by the handfuls, stirring continuously, until it is all wilted.
  5. Deglaze the pan with the red wine, stirring frequently for 60 seconds.
  6. Stir in the Italian seasoning, black pepper, crushed red pepper, and salt.
  7. Add the diced tomatoes and stir well until all ingredients are incorporated. 
  8. Turn the heat to medium, cover, and let cook for 5 minutes.
  9. Remove the lid and create eight wells in the mixture.
  10. Gently add a cracked egg into each well. Cover again and cook for an additional 6 minutes, or until the white is firm and yolk is set.

1. Toast your bread to your desired doneness.
  2. While the bread is toasting, mix together the salmon and lemon juice.
  3. Lay the sliced avocado on your toast and top with the salmon mixture.
  4. Garnish with red pepper flakes, salt, pepper and anything else you can think of!
  5. Enjoy!

1. Arrange together into a beautiful floral arrangement.
  2. Add to a vase with fresh water.
  3. Consume after viewing, if desired.

1. In a small saute pan, lightly toast your slivered almonds over medium heat. Be careful not to burn them!
  2. In a medium sauce pan over medium heat, combine the milk, cocoa powder, stevia, coconut and almond extract and whisk well until the cocoa powder is well incorporated.
  3. Heat until desired temperature is reached. Don't boil.
  4. Serve the virgin hot cocoa to the kiddos.
  5. Stir in the rum for mom and dad.
  6. Garnish with whipped regular or coconut cream.
  7. Top with toasted almonds.
  8. Enjoy!

1. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the milk and quinoa. Cook according to the package directions.
    2. Once cooked, stir in the maple syrup and vanilla extract.
    3. Evenly divide the mixture among four individual pint-sized mason jars.
    4. Evenly top each jar with berries and almonds. Secure a tight-fitting lid.
    5. Store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Enjoy cold or warmed up in the microwave for 1-1½ minutes.

1. Top the flat bread with avocado and smash with a fork.
  2. Top with yellow fin tuna straight from the packet - no need to drain!
  3. Garnish with sprouts, hemp seeds, and squeeze on lemon juice.
  4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. 
  2. Drain the excess water from the tofu package.
  3. Drain the excess water from the tofu package and Slice the block lengthwise into 1/4 inch slabs.
  4. Slice those slabs into bite sized pieces and arrange in a flat layer atop a clean cloth.
  5. Top with an additional clean cloth and top with a book or something heavy, to squeeze the water out. Let rest 15 minutes.
  6. While waiting, mix together the wet ingredients: olive oil, soy sauce, and garlic in a small bowl.
  7. Whisk together the dry ingredients: the cornflour, nutritional yeast, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
  8. After 15 minutes, remove the weight and top cloth from the tofu and brush with the olive oil mixture on both sides. 
  9. Transfer the tofu to the large bowl with the dry ingredients and toss until well coated.
  10. Arrange the coated tofu on a foil-lined baking sheet in an even layer.
  11. Coat all pieces evenly with cooking spray.
  12. Bake for 30 minutes, flipping once and spraying again with cooking spray halfway through.
  13. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce - marinara is my family's favorite! Enjoy!

1. Line a baking sheet with foil or parchment paper and set aside.
  2. Wash and pat dry your strawberries well. Set aside.
  3. In a microwave-safe bowl, combine the chocolate chips and coconut oil.
  4. Microwave 60 seconds. Remove and stir.
  5. Continue to microwave on 30-second intervals until smooth.
  6. Using a digital thermometer, ensure the temperature is lower than 240 degrees. If it is, gently stir in the CBD concentrate. If it is not, wait until the temperature is below 240 degrees before stirring in the CBD concentrate.
  7. Gently dip the strawberries into the chocolate, letting the excess chocolate run off before setting on the lined baking sheet.
  8. Sprinkle edible rose petals over the chocolate while it is still wet.
  9. Repeat until all strawberries are covered.
  10. Enjoy!

1. Boil eggs however you traditionally do. We all have our own special way! 
  2. Personally, I place my eggs in a pot, cover with water with vinegar and salt. Bring the pot to a boil, once at a rolling boil, set the timer and allow to boil for 5 minutes. 
  3. After 5 minutes, turn the heat completely off and let the eggs sit for another 5 minutes.
  4.  After five minutes, drain and run the eggs under cold water to cool and peel. 
  5. While the eggs are boiling, put the avocado and lemon juice in a bowl and mash well.
  6. When the eggs are ready,  slice the eggs in half, and put the yolks in the bowl with the mashed avocado.
  7.  Mash the yolks and avocado together. Stir well to completely combine.
  8. Season with salt, garlic powder, cayenne pepper and turmeric and mix well.
  9. Taste, and add more seasoning or lemon juice as needed.
  10. Spoon mixture into the egg whites. 
  11. Sprinkle with paprika as desired.
  12. Garnish with hemp seeds and micro-greens.
  13. Enjoy!

1. Thinly slice your pear and red pepper. 
  2. Gently toss sliced pears and red pepper with the arugula and Parmesan cheese.
  3. If preparing ahead of time, put this mixture in a sealable plastic container.
  4. Garnish with walnuts and additional Parmesan cheese as desired.
  5. Gently toss with the citrus vinaigrette right before consumption.
  6. Enjoy!

1. Let the frozen bananas, cauliflower and strawberries thaw a bit before blending. Either let them sit out for 30 minutes or microwave for 60 seconds.
  2. Combine all of the ingredients, banana, cauliflower, strawberries, coconut milk and wine flour and blend until smooth.
  3. Enjoy!

1. Add the bananas, spinach, avocado, mint leaves, plant-based milk, and vanilla extract to the blender.
  2. Blend on high for 60-90 seconds, or until smooth and creamy.
  3. Top with coconut whipped cream and garnish with raw cacao nibs or vegan chocolate chips as desired.

1. Get the wok or cast iron pan hot and add the sesame oil.
  2. Add the cauliflower florets and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring constantly.
  3. Add the remaining sesame oil, liquid aminos, and snow peas and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
  4. Add the sesame seeds and cook for an additional 30 seconds before removing from heat. Enjoy!

1. In a large bowl, mix all ingredients together well.
  2. Enjoy!

1. Add the garlic, parsley, olive oil and lemon juice to the food processor and pulse until roughly chopped.
  2. Reserve a spoonful of the garlic mixture to be used as garnish.
  3. Add the remaining ingredients to the food processor and blend for several minutes until  smooth.
  4. Garnish with reserved garlic mixture and enjoy!

1. Gently cut each slice of bread into 4 'sticks'. Set aside.
  2. Preheat a griddle over medium heat. Coat with butter or coconut oil.
  3. In a shallow bowl, whisk together the eggs and cinnamon.
  4. Gently dip each strip of bread into the egg mixture, flipping once to coat evenly. Place on the hot griddle.
  5. Cook each french toast stick for 2-3 minutes before flipping.
  6. Cook an additional 2-3 minutes on the other-side until the french toast sticks are golden brown.
  7. Remove from heat and enjoy! Dip in syrup or your favorite sweet dip, like yogurt!

1. Prepare the jicama by using a vegetable peeler to peel off the brown outside. Then dice the jicama into small, 1/4 inch cubes.
  2. Peel and dice the mango and avocado and gently toss with the jicama in a large bowl.
  3. In a small bowl, whisk together the honey (or maple), lime juice and chili powder.
  4. Pour the honey mixture over the jicama, mango and avocado and toss well. 
  5. Let the salad rest, or marinate, for at least 30-minutes before serving.
  6. Stir well & enjoy!
1. Super easy, pour everything into a blender, mix and enjoy!

1. In a large bowl, combine the cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion with salt and pepper. Toss well to combine and let rest for 10 minutes.
  2. After resting, stir the mixture and add in the basil, parsley, oregano, garlic, vinegar, olive oil, and crushed red pepper (if using). Stir until well combined.
  3. Let the ingredients sit another 5 minutes to marinate. This will allow the flavors to come together.
  4. Stir just before serving & enjoy!

1. Slice the cucumbers down the middle lengthwise. Using a spoon, gently scoop out the insides. Discard (or compost) the scooped seeds and set the remaining cucumber halves aside.
  2. In a medium-sized bowl, add the tuna. Using a fork, gently mash the tuna until it is flaked.
  3. Add the celery, Greek yogurt, onion, mustard, salt, black pepper, and fresh dill, if using. Mix well.
  4. Scoop the tuna salad into each cucumber half just before serving.

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with foil and arrange the torn bread pieces in a single flat layer. Drizzle with olive oil, garlic powder, and parsley. Toss gently to coat.
  2. Bake the croutons for 10-minutes, stirring once halfway through. The cooked croutons should be toasted and golden brown. Once cooked, remove from the oven and set aside to cool.
  3. If you haven't already, spiralize your zucchini into 'zoodles'. If you do not have a spiralizer, simply use a vegetable peeler to make thin strips of zucchini 'noodles'.
  4. In a large mixing bowl add the spiralized zucchini, grape tomatoes, roasted red pepper, sliced mushrooms, scallions. Toss well.
  5. Add the Lemon Vinaigrette to the bowl and toss well until all ingredients are lightly coated.
  6. Gently toss in the homemade croutons and fresh mozzarella. Serve immediately.

For the Agave Balsamic Sauce

  1. In a squeeze bottle or a mason jar with a tight fitting lid, combine the agave syrup, balsamic vinegar, black pepper, crushed red pepper, granulated garlic, granulated onion, and salt. Replace the cap or lid and shake vigorously.
  2. Set aside until the skewers are cooked.
  3. Shake again just before serving.

For the Veggie Kabobs

  1. Place your vegetables on the skewers in any manner you wish. We went for colors of the rainbow by adding: 1 mushroom, 2 pieces of eggplant, 1 wedge of red onion, 2 pieces of zucchini, 2 pieces of yellow squash, 3 pieces of orange pepper, 2 tomatoes, finished with 1 mushroom.
  2. You can grill your kabobs right away or cover them and refrigerate for up to 24 hours before grilling.
  3. Just before grilling, generously sprinkle each skewer with salt and black pepper and spray with a good amount of cooking spray so they don’t stick to the grill.
  4. Preheat the grill to high heat. (If you have a very powerful grill, you may want to cook the kabobs on a top rack to prevent burning.
  5. Place the kabobs on the grill and cook for 2-minutes per side, flipping to cook on each of the 4 sides of the skewer.
  6. Cook until you achieve your desired doneness.
  7. Remove the kabobs from the grill and generously drizzle each kabob with the agave balsamic sauce just before serving. Enjoy!

1. If you have not already, soak your wooden skewers in water so they don't catch fire on the grill.
  2. Heat the grill to medium high heat.
  3. With your vegetables prepped and ready, arrange them on the skewers.
  4. Brush with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
  5. Cook 3-4 minutes before flipping.
  6. Continue cooking until veggies are cooked to your desired texture.
  7. Remove from the grill and brush with pesto.
  8. Enjoy!

1. In a medium bowl, add butter lettuce and Thai basil.
  2. Top with edamame, cabbage, carrots, mango, and avocado.
  3. Add chopped beef jerky.
  4. Garnish with scallions, sesame seeds, and dressing. Enjoy!

For the Chipotle BBQ Sauce

  1. In a small sauce pan, heat oil on medium heat.
  2. Add the onions and salt and cook until onions become soft and translucent, stirring occasionally. 
  3. Add the minced garlic and cook until it starts to soften (but don't let the garlic brown).
  4. Add the apple cider vinegar and turn the heat to medium-high, until almost boiling.
  5. Add the ketchup, honey, Worcestershire and chipotle peppers.
  6. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly to prevent sticking.
  7. Once boiling, turn the sauce to low and simmer for 30 minutes.
  8. After 30 minutes, use an immersion blender (or transfer contents to traditional blender) and blend until smooth.

For the Grilled Pork Skewers

  1. Cut the pork into strips by slicing the pork chop in half lengthwise into 1/2 inch pieces. Note: the length doesn't matter.
  2. Skewer 2 pieces of meat per stick lengthwise, ensuring the meat remains flat for even cooking.
  3. Apply salt and pepper to taste to both sides of the pork.
  4. Turn the grill on to high heat.
  5. Liberally oil the grill with non-stick cooking spray or a clean rag soaked with olive oil.
  6. Carefully lay the skewers on the well oiled grill. 
  7. Quickly brush the pork side facing up with your homemade Chipotle BBQ Sauce and cook for 1-2 minutes before flipping.
  8. After flipping all of the skewers, brush the other side and grill for another 1-2 minutes or until an internal temperature of 140 degrees is reached.
  9. Remove the skewers from the grill and wrap tightly in foil. Let the meat rest for approximately 10 minutes. During this time the pork will continue to cook and reach an internal temperate of 145 degrees.
  10. Serve with additional Chiptole BBQ Sauce as desired. Enjoy!

1. To start place your granola, hemp seeds and cacao nibs into a plastic bag and remove as much air as possible. Seal tight.
  2. Using a rolling pin, crush the cereal until it is broken down into fine pieces. Set aside.
  3. Peel the banana and evenly cover all sides in your choice of nut butter.
  4. Place the coated banana in the crushed cereal and roll many times to cover completely. Use your hand to press the cereal into the banana as needed.
  5. Using a knife, cut the banana into 1/4-1/2" pieces.
  6. Enjoy!

1. In a medium saucepan over medium heat add the coffee, pumpkin, coconut sugar, pumpkin pie spice, and vanilla extract. Heat for 3-5 minutes, or until hot, but not boiling.
  2. While the coffee is cooking, add the coconut milk to the frothing pitcher and place over medium heat.
  3. When the temperature reaches between 100-150 degrees, you can begin to use the frother. Remove the pitcher from heat and continue to froth when the temperature reaches 160 degrees.
  4. Move the frother in a circular, up & down motion, until 1-2 inches of foam is formed.
  5. Divide the coffee mixture between two mugs and add the desired amount of CBD oil.
  6. Using a spoon to hold back the foam, add the hot milk to each cup. Aim for a 2:1 milk to coffee ratio.
  7. Spoon the remaining foam into each mug. Top with freshly grated nutmeg as desired.

1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
  2. Using a large knife, carefully cut the butternut squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out the seeds.
  3. Lay the butternut squash halves face up on a foil-lined baking sheet.
  4. Drizzle with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
  5. Roast in the oven for 1 hour, or until the squash is golden brown on the edges.
  6. Remove the squash from the oven and let it rest until it is cool enough to handle.
  7. Gently scoop the roasted butternut squash out of the skin and into a large soup pot. Discard the skin.
  8. Add the coconut milk and turn the heat to medium, allow the coconut milk and butternut squash to warm for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  9. Add the vegetable stock and all of the spices.
  10. Using an immersion blender, blend all of the ingredients together until the soup is smooth and creamy. 
  11. Allow to cook over medium heat for another 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  12. Serve garnished with pumpkin seeds if desired and Enjoy!

1. Cook the freekeh, or your whole grain of choice, according to the package directions.
  2. Dice the chicken tenderloin into uniform sized 1/2 inch pieces. Liberally season with salt, pepper, and fresh thyme and set aside.
  3. In a large soup pot, melt the butter over medium heat.
  4. Add the onion and celery and sweat together for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  5. Add the diced chicken to the soup pot and cook for an additional 3-4 minutes, stirring frequently. 
  6. Stir in the garlic just before adding the chicken broth. Turn the heat to high and bring the soup to a boil.
  7. Once boiling, reduce the heat to medium and add the cabbage by the handful, stirring frequently,
  8. Reduce the heat to low simmer for 10 minutes.
  9. Add 1/2 cup of Freekeh to each soup bowl just before serving.

1. Pop the popcorn according to package directions.
  2. Set each individual ingredient out in it's own container.
  3. Get one big bucket for each child to make their own popcorn mix. Allow them to choose freely which delicious additions they would like to include.
  4. Have fun and be present in the moment!

For the Meatballs

  1. In a large bowl, combine all of the meatball ingredients. Using your hands, mix together well.
  2. Once the meatball ingredients are mixed together well, roll into 1" meatballs. Set aside.
  3. Add the oil for frying in a large cast iron skillet and neatly arrange all of the meatballs inside.
  4. Heat the meatballs over medium-high heat. Use a oil splatter screen if necessary to protect yourself from oil splatters.
  5. Cook the meatballs for 3-4 minutes on the first side. They are ready to flip when they easily release from the bottom of the pan.
  6. Flip and cook on the other side for 3-4 minutes, rotating to the other sides as necessary to ensure an even crust.
  7. Cook the meatballs until an internal temperature of 155 degrees is reached.

For the Tzatziki Sauce

  1. Combine all ingredients in a small food processor and blend until fine pieces are achieved.
  2. Serve as a dipping sauce with the Greek Lamb Meatballs.

1. In a large bowl, mix everything together until all of the ingredients are well incorporated.
  2. Using your hands, begin to create 1 inch balls and roll between your palms until they are perfectly ball-shaped.
  3. Store in the refrigerator for up to 7 days or the freezer for up to 3 months.
  4. Enjoy!

1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and set the rack in the middle of the oven. Coat a 9-inch square baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.
  2. In a stand mixer bowl or large bowl, beat the sugar, honey, and oil until well blended. Beat in the eggs and vanilla. Beat in the yogurt until the batter is smooth.
  3. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. Add the flour mixture to the egg mixture and beat until all the ingredients are incorporated. Mix in the walnuts. 
  4. Pour the better into the prepared pan. Push the cherries into the batter, three to a row in three rows, so one will be at the center of each brownie once you cut them into squares.
  5. Bake the brownies for 18-20 minutes or until just set. Remove from the oven and place on a rack to cool for 5 minutes or so. Cut into nine squares and serve.

1. Arrange all ingredients on a cutting board.
  2. Serve and enjoy!

1. If using vermicelli rice noodles, soak them in hot water for 5 minutes to soften before draining.
  2. In a small bowl, mix together the shredded chicken, aminos and ginger. Set aside.
  3. On a flat surface, lay the collard green wrap down and carefully remove any prominent stems as needed.
  4. Fill the collard green wrap in the center with the chicken mixture, avocado, carrots, cabbage and bell pepper.
  5. If using the rice noodles, drain and add to the wrap.
  6. Add the crushed peanuts.
  7. Roll the collard green wrap shut like a burrito, tucking in the ends and sides to ensure no ingredients slip out.
  8. Cut in half just before serving. Enjoy!

1. Place the almonds in a small saucepan and cover with cold water. Place over the stove on high until the water begins to boil. Allow the almonds to boil for 60 seconds before removing them from the heat. Drain and run under cool water.
  2. When cool enough to touch, gently peel the skin from the outside of the almond using your nails or by rubbing your index finger and thumb together with the almond in between.
  3. Return the peeled almonds and add the cashews back to the saucepan and cover with cold water.
  4. Place the saucepan over high heat. Once the water begins to boil, add a cover and reduce the heat to low and let the nuts simmer for 20 minutes.
  5. Drain the nuts and place them in a food processor or blender.
  6. Begin pulsing on high in 15-second intervals, stopping to scrape the sides in-between times. It will take several minutes of pulsing to turn the nuts into a fine consistency.
  7. When you stop to scrape the sides, if the mixture seems dry, intermittently add a tablespoon of coconut milk until a total of 12 tablespoons are added.
  8. Continue to pulse until the mixture becomes creamy. Then pulse for another 2 minutes. Check for yourself, the texture should be like hummus, smooth with not a lot of grit.
  9. Once the nuts are at or just near the consistency you desire, you can begin to add the additional ingredients.
  10. Add the vanilla and almond extract first and pulse for another 30 seconds.
  11. Then add the powdered sugar, pulse again.
  12. Then add the vegan cream cheese. Pulse again until completely smooth.
  13. Put in your favorite serving dish. Garnish with raw cacao nibs and chopped pistachios. Enjoy!

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F. Grease a 9” glass pie dish with room temperature butter.
    2. Add the Parmesan cheese and gently shake the pie dish until you have a light, even coating across the bottom and sides. Set aside.
    3. Place a medium skillet over medium heat and add the olive oil, onion, and ½ teaspoon of salt. Sauté for 2 minutes.
    4. Add the mushrooms, spinach, and garlic cook for 3-4 minutes. Turn off the heat and set aside.
    5. Carefully crack the eggs and transfer them into a large bowl.
    6. Whisk in the milk, turmeric, black pepper, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt.

1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
    2. In a medium pot on the stovetop or in a tea kettle, bring 6-8 cups of water to a boil.
    3. In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the fresh mango puree, coconut milk, and vanilla bean. Stir well. Bring mixture to a boil.
    4. Once boiling, turn the heat off and allow the mixture to stand for 10 minutes.
    5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and 1/4 cup sugar until well combined.
    6. While whisking, slowly ladle the mango cream into the egg yolk mixture until all of the cream is fully incorporated.
    7. Pour the final mixture evenly into small oven-safe ramekins.
    8. Place the ramekins into another larger, oven-safe vessel.
    9. Pour the boiling water into the vessel, around the ramekins, until the water reaches 2/3 of the way full.
    10. Carefully place into the oven and bake for 40 minutes. You want to make sure the custard is set on the outside edge with a soft (but not soupy) center in the middle.
    11. Carefully remove the pan from the oven. Allow the ramekins to cool while still in the water bath.
    12. When able to handle ramekins safely, place in the refrigerator, uncovered, to finish cooling.
    13. Allow cooling completely, at least 3 hours. Overnight is best.
    14. Crème Brûlée can sit in the refrigerator for 2-3 days before caramelizing if needed.

Caramelized Sugar Topping

    1. When caramelizing the tops of your Crème Brûlée, be sure to work one ramekin at a time for the best results.
    2. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of sugar over the Crème Brûlée and gently shake to distribute evenly among the top.
    3. With a lit torch, hold the base of the Crème Brûlée in your hand and gently torch the sugar.
    4. As the sugar starts to melt, keep the torch and ramekin moving in circular motions to evenly distribute the heat and prevent burning.
    5. The sugar should be golden brown and create a syrup-like consistency that will be rock hard when cool.
    6. Allow cooling for 2 minutes before serving.
    7. Garnish with fresh mango as desired.

1. Sterilize a mason jar or other glass container with a tight-fitting lid by submerging it in boiling water. This will kill any pathogens that may potentially infiltrate your yogurt.
    2. Add the can of full-fat coconut milk to the sterilized container and shake or still until well combined and smooth.
    3. Carefully twist the probiotic capsules until the end caps come apart, sprinkle the contents into the mason jar.
    4. Shake or stir vigorously until well combined.
    5. Allow the jar to sit on the counter, covered with a mason jar lid, for 24-48 hours to allow the fermentation process to activate. Shake occasionally.
    6. After 24-48 hours, put the mason jar into the refrigerator. This will allow the mixture to thicken to your desired consistency.
    7. Stir in the maple syrup, sea salt, and collagen peptides if using. Refrigerate for up to 7-days.

1. For this recipe we will be following the Boiling Water-Processing method. Fill halfway, with water, bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer of 180 degrees F. Keep aside.
  2. Harvest, wash and drain the berries.
  3. Using a potato masher or wooden spoon, crush the berries until they are coarse. Measure out 4.5 cups of crushed berries with juice.
  4. In a large saucepan, add the crushed berries, sugar, lemon juice, and vanilla. Stir well.
  5. Over low-medium heat, slowly bring the mixture to a boil, stirring occasionally until the sugar has been dissolved.
  6. Once the sugar has dissolved, increase the heat to medium-high and quickly bring the mixture the gelling point temperature of 220 degrees F, stirring constantly. Remove from heat once the temperature is reached.
  7. Carefully ladle the hot jam into a *hot* sterilized mason jar, leaving 1/4 inch headspace.
  8. Gently tap to remove any bubbles, clean the jar rim as needed, and top with the center lid and tightly screw on the metal band. Repeat until all jars are filled.
  9. Place the sealed jars on the rack in the boiling-water processor that is elevated above the water. Once all of the jars are in place, lower the rack into the simmering water, ensuring the jars are covered by at least 1-inch of water.
  10. Adjust the heat to medium-high, cover with a lid and bring the water to a rolling boil. Allow the water to boil for 15 minutes.
  11. After 15 minutes, turn off the heat and remove the cover for 5 minutes. Carefully remove the jars from the canner and cool at room temperature for 12 hours.
  12. Label and store jars for future use.

1. Choose Your Journaling Medium

      It doesn't matter whether you choose to keep your gratitude journal the old-fashioned, pen and paper way or digitally on your phone or computer.

      All that matters is that it is a medium that works for you and your personality in order to keep you focused, organized and committed.

      If you're looking for the perfect gratitude journal, I highly recommend this Gratitude Journal: Good Days Start With Gratitude: A 52 Week Guide to Cultivate an Attitude of Gratitude.

      [mv_img id="10255"]
    2. Define Your Purpose

      Having a clear goal in mind for your practice will help you to discover all the ways gratitude can benefit your life overall and help you to focus on what you will be writing down.

      [mv_img id="9840"]
    3. Commit to a Frequency

      How often you want to write in your gratitude journal is up to you, and should fit nicely with your current lifestyle. Whatever you decide, commit to a frequent schedule to keep you on track, but don't get too bogged down by a schedule.

      [mv_img id="17947"]
    4. Focus on Cultivating Positivity

      Whether you spend just five minutes a day or thirty minutes at the end of the week, your practice should focus on cultivating positivity and bringing joy into your life.

      [mv_img id="14217"]

For the Gingerbread Cake:

    1. Place egg whites in a bowl and let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.

1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
  2. Add the hemp seeds to an oven-safe baking dish.
  3. Bake for 12-15 minutes, stirring every 3-5 minutes until the seeds are golden brown.
  4. Remove from oven and let cool to room temperature.
  5. Add the toasted hemp seeds to a food processor with the coconut sugar and salt.
  6. Pulse the seeds for 60-90 seconds until a flour-like consistency is reached.
  7. Continue to pulse in 5-10 second intervals until a dough-like consistency is formed.
  8. Scrape the sides down, break down any clumps, and add the coconut oil.
  9. Turn the food processor on high and run consistency until a creamy consistency is achieved. Stop a few times to scrape down the sides of the food processor, as needed, to ensure all ingredients are blended.
  10. Blend until a butter-like consistency is reached.
  11. Stir in any additional flavorings, if using, before enjoying.

1. Lay a clean tea towel down on the bottom of the crockpot. This will create a buffer between your mason jars and the crockpot, potentially preventing any jar moving or cracking during cooking.
  2. Fill your crockpot with enough hot water to cover the top of the mason jars you plan on using by an inch to create a water bath. We used these jars.
  3. Start the heat on high then turn to low when a temperature of 185° F is reached.
  4. While the water bath is heating in the crockpot, measure and decarb the cannabis flower in the oven at 240° F for 40 minutes. If needed, click here for a full cannabis decarboxylation tutorial.
  5. Evenly divide the coconut oil between the mason jars, leaving a 1/2 inch space from the top. If using sunflower lecithin, add it in here.
  6. Divide the decarbed flower between the coconut oil filled jars. Wipe the rim of the jars with a clean paper towel and place the lid on, tighten the metal ring to finger-tip tight. It does not have to be tightened all the way.
  7. Carefully place the jars into the water bath, place the lid on the crockpot, and cook for 4 hours.
  8. After 4 hours, carefully remove the jars from the water and allow them to cool enough to handle. Strain the cannabis oil through a paper filter or cheesecloth to separate the plant-matter from the coconut oil.
  9. Return the prepared cannabis oil to whatever jar you would like to store it in.
  10. Store this oil in a cool, dry place. It will last longer in the refrigerator and even longer in the freezer. If you are storing the oil in the fridge, never use the microwave to soften it as it could destroy the cannabinoids.

    2. Using a digital scale, weigh the cannabis flower to your desired weight. For example: 0.25, 0.5, or 1.0 ounces. [mv_img id="28404"]

1. In a 1-quart saucepot over medium heat, add all of the ingredients except for the cannabis coconut oil.
  2. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Allow to boil for 1 minute.

1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.

  3. Place the 2 packets next to each other on counter and open like a book. Working on the right-side half, approximately 2 inches from the fold, center 2 lemons from top to bottom in each packet. [mv_img id="28502"]

En Papillote Folding Instructions:

Parchment Paper Packets: fold over the empty half of the packet and make sure all the edges line up together. Starting at the bottom of the packet, next to the center crease, fold approximately a 1-2 inch wide section of the edge towards the inside center of the packet. Making a 1/2 inch deep fold, starting 3/4 of the way to the end of last fold, take another section 1-2 inches and fold towards the center of packet making a half-inch deep fold. Repeat this process around the perimeter of the packet, making sure that all folds are creased well and sealed.

Aluminum Foil Packets: fold over the empty half of the packet and make sure all the edges line up together. Starting at the bottom of the packet, make one straight horizontal fold about 1/2 inch deep working upwards. Do this one more time and then repeat this process for the top of the packet working downwards. When the top and bottom are sealed, fold the left edge in one vertical line 1/2 inch deep back towards the main crease, repeat this 2-3 times, make sure all folds are creased and sealed.

1. Preheat a water bath to 185° F. Various water bath techniques are explained in the notes section below.
  2. In a small cast iron pan over medium heat, add the whole cardamom pods. Constantly move the pan to stir and prevent burning for 3-4 minutes.
  3. Add the whole black peppercorns and cook an additional 3-4 minutes, constantly moving the pan to stir.
  4. Add the cinnamon stick, whole allspice berries, whole anise pod, and whole cloves. Cook for 2-3 minutes and then turn off the pan. You are looking for fragrant spices with a light golden brown hue.
  5. Shake well and pour coconut milk into a mason a jar and then add the brown sugar, Ceylon tea, decarbed cannabis flower, vanilla bean or extract, and fresh ginger.
  6. When the spices are cool enough to handle, break the cinnamon stick by hand into smaller pieces and hand crack open the cardamom pods.
  7. Add all of the toasted spices to the coconut milk mixture and gently stir to incorporate.
  8. With a clean paper towel, wipe the rim of the jar and place the lid on, tighten the metal ring till fingertip tight (it does not need to be tightened all the way down.)
  9. Carefully lower the sealed jar into the water bath. When the water bath returns to 185° F and starts a timer for 2 hours. Allow cooking undisturbed.
  10. After 2 hours, remove the mason jar from the water bath and place it onto a tea towel-lined work surface. Remove the lid and give a couple of gentle stirs.
  11. Using a fine-mesh strainer, cone filter, doubled up cheesecloth or even a coffee filter; strain the tea into another mason jar or other heat resistant vessel.
  12. This can be enjoyed immediately, garnished with fresh ground cinnamon or decarbed kief for a little extra jazz. This chai can also be enjoyed cold.
  13. Store in the refrigerator for up to a week. If you plan to reheat this chai after cooling, do so slowly in a saucepot. Do NOT microwave the chai as you will risk overheating and denaturing your cannabis cannabinoids.

  10. After 10 minutes, remove the pan from the oven and allow the pan to cool on a cooling rack.

1. If you haven't already, decarboxylate your cannabis by baking it in a 240° F oven for 40 minutes. Click here for a full tutorial on cannabis decarboxylation, if needed.
  2. Place the decarboxylated cannabis flower at the bottom of a pint-sized mason jar.
  3. Pour the Everclear alcohol over the cannabis flower. Screw the cap tightly and shake gently.
  4. Place the mason jar in a cool, dark location like a cupboard or closet and leave to infuse.
  5. Remove the tincture from the cupboard to shake gently once daily for the next 10 days.
  6. After 10 days, strain the cannabis tincture through a coffee filter or cheesecloth into a clean mason jar, separating the plant-matter from the alcohol.
